title: Understanding Appendicitis -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Symptoms of Appendicitis?
content: The classic symptoms of appendicitis include:
In many cases, atypical symptoms appear, including:
bullets: Dull pain near the navel or the upper or lower abdomen that becomes sharp as it moves to the lower right abdomen; this is usually the first sign, but it occurs in less than half of appendicitis cases.
Nausea or vomiting soon after abdominal pain begins
Dull or sharp pain anywhere in the upper or lower abdomen, back, or rectum
Vomiting that precedes the abdominal pain

content_blocks.text: The classic symptoms of appendicitis include:
associated_bullets: Dull pain near the navel or the upper or lower abdomen that becomes sharp as it moves to the lower right abdomen; this is usually the first sign, but it occurs in less than half of appendicitis cases.
Nausea or vomiting soon after abdominal pain begins

content_blocks.text: In many cases, atypical symptoms appear, including:
associated_bullets: Dull or sharp pain anywhere in the upper or lower abdomen, back, or rectum
Vomiting that precedes the abdominal pain

sections.heading: Call Your Doctor About Appendicitis If:
content: After an appendectomy, call your doctor right away if you have:
bullets: You have any of the symptoms listed above; acute appendicitis is a medical emergency that can be fatal. Prompt surgery is often essential. Do not eat, drink, or use any pain remedies, antacids, laxatives , or heating pads, which can cause an inflamed appendix to rupture.

You have symptoms of appendicitis, but your appendix has already been removed; you may have a urinary tract infection, pelvic inflammatory disease , diverticulitis, a tubal pregnancy , gastroenteritis , or inflammation of your colon , called colitis or Crohn's disease , or colorectal cancer . Seek medical care immediately.
Blood in your vomit, urine, or stool

items: You have any of the symptoms listed above; acute appendicitis is a medical emergency that can be fatal. Prompt surgery is often essential. Do not eat, drink, or use any pain remedies, antacids, laxatives , or heating pads, which can cause an inflamed appendix to rupture.

You have symptoms of appendicitis, but your appendix has already been removed; you may have a urinary tract infection, pelvic inflammatory disease , diverticulitis, a tubal pregnancy , gastroenteritis , or inflammation of your colon , called colitis or Crohn's disease , or colorectal cancer . Seek medical care immediately.

content_blocks.text: After an appendectomy, call your doctor right away if you have:
associated_bullets: Blood in your vomit, urine, or stool

meta_description: WebMD's guide to the warning signs of appendicitis.
